results.title: Zaa le Petit Chameau
results.brief_description:
Ali has new friend, a white camel called Zaa. But Zaa is kidnapped and taken to the market in Monastia (Algeria) to be sold. Narrated by Francois Perier.

Credits: Director, Jacques Poitrenaud ; writer, Claude Roy ; photography, Andre Dumaitre ; music, Guy Bernard.
Cast: No cast information available.

results.title: Django Reindhardt
results.brief_description:
This short film about Jazz legend Django Reinhardt is introduced by a text by Jean Cocteau. Commentary by Chris Marker, narrated by Yves Montand. Other musicians featured include Stephane Grapelli, Hubert Rostain, Andre Ekyan, Henri Crolla, Babyk Reinhardt.

Credits: Producer, Madeleine Casanova-Rodriguez ; director, writer, Paul Paviot ; photography, Jean Le Herissey ; music, Django Reinhardt.

results.title: Jacques Henri Lartigue, Peintre et Photographe
results.brief_description:
“If we think of photography as a documentary art, our attention is likely to focus first on images of battle or disaster, deprivation or unrest. Indeed, outside the familiar confines of the family album or the surreal arena of celebrity, archival photographs most powerfully frame gritty realities our eyes might otherwise avoid. Not so with the pictures of Jacques Henri Lartigue (1894-1986), who produced stunning and sophisticated images from the time he was seven years old. Lartigue was in love with motion, and his subjects cars racing, flying machines and glider planes, people jumping, fashionable ladies strolling in the park, vacationers at the seashore and the races embody the exhilaration of movement. Zany and amusing, Lartigue’s work seems a testament to happiness itself, and this book with 126 duotone photos and 16 gatefolds is a fitting celebration of his legacy.” Reference: Vicki Goldberg. ‘Jacques Henri Lartigue, photographer’. Bulfinch Press, 1998.

Credits: Producer, Bernard Meusnier ; director, Francois Reichenbach ; photographer, Francois Reichenbach, Gerard de Battista.
Cast: Interviewees include Michel Tournier, Jean-Michel Folon and Charlotte Rampling.

results.title: Picasso Peintre du Siecle = Picasso Artist of the Century
results.brief_description:
Profile of one of the most influential artist of the 20th century. Highlights includes the genesis of the famous painting ‘Guernica’.

Credits: Producer, Simon Schiffrin ; director, Lauro Venturi ; writer, Jean Leymarie ; photography, Jean Bourgoin ; music, Roman Vlad.
Cast: Alain Mottet [narration only].

results.title: Heureux Comme le Regard En France
results.brief_description:
Documentary on the Centre National d’Art et de Culture Georges Pompidou, better known as Beaubourg, in Paris. The Centre is presented through the events organised in 1977 by its various units, especially IRCAM (experimental music) and the Modern Art Museum.

Credits: Director, Frederic Rossif ; writer, Alain Jouffroy ; photography, Jacques Loiseleux, Jean Boffety ; music, Vangelis Papathanassiou.
Cast: Michel Duchaussoy [narration only].

results.title: Un Inconnu Nomme Eiffel
results.brief_description:
Gustave Eiffel was afraid that his famous tower would overshadow his other accomplishments. This short film sets out to shed light on a very prolific international engineering career which included the building of railway bridges, viaducts and the metal frame of the Statue of Liberty.

Credits: Director, Joan Laskoff ; photography, Jacques Mercanton ; music, Betty Willemetz.
